FIGURE IE shows inhibition of OGT-catalyzed transfer of O-GlcNAc onto nup62 by UDP-5SGlcNAc. The K value, determined by Dixon analysis, is 8 μΜ.
The plot shows the densitometry analysis and yields an EC<sub>50</sub> value for reduction of O-GlcNAc levels of 5 μΜ.

The plot shows the densitometry analysis converted to a % O-GlcNAc modification (corrected for actin levels) relative to the untreated control sample as a function of dose; this gives an EC<sub>50</sub> of 700 μΜ.
The plot shows the densitometry analysis converted to a % O-GlcNAc modification (corrected for actin levels) relative to the untreated control sample as a function of dose; this gives an EC50 of 0.8 μΜ.

Here are the extracted sentences with concrete data points that meet the specified criteria:


Assays contained 30 μΜ nup62, 20 μΜ UDP-(5S)GlcNAc and 0.4 μΜ OGT in 20 mM phosphate, pH 7.4, 150 mM NaCl (phosphate buffered saline; PBS), in a total volume of 100 μί, and were allowed to proceed for an appropriate time between 10 min and 2 h at 37 °C in order to maintain a constant rate without substrate depletion.
The concentration was determined from a standard curve of UDP standards, which were prepared in triplicate using the same procedure as the reactions, at a concentration of between 1 and 20 μΜ.
Assays contained 18 μΜ of nup62, 1 μΜ of UDP-GlcNAc (constant specific activity of 0.5 Ci/mmol of [<sup>3</sup>H]-UDP-GlcNAc), 100 nM OGT, and various concentrations (0-25 μΜ) of UDP-5SGlcNAc in PBS.
The F<sub>max</sub> for OGT was determined using high (30, 40 and 50 μΜ) concentrations of UDP-GlcNAc (containing 0.033, 0.025, 0.02 Ci/mmol specific activity, respectively).

Here are the extracted sentences with concrete data points that meet the specified criteria:


UDP-5SGlcNAc is an effective inhibitor of OGT with a value of 8 μΜ (Figure IE), indicating that it binds as well as the natural substrate UDP-GlcNAc (K<sub>m</sub> = 2-7 μΜ).
The western blots reveal the EC<sub>50</sub> values for Ac-5SGlcNAc and 5SGlcNAc to be 5 μΜ and 700 μΜ respectively, which is consistent with acetylation facilitating entry of 5SGlcNAc into cells.
A time course and dose response study in CHO cells (Figures 2J-K), revealed a similar EC50 value (0.8 μΜ).
At 50 μΜ we find near complete loss of O-GlcNAc in the cell lines tested, yet UDP-GlcNAc levels are still more than 60% of basal levels;
